Key Match Events: Jhonkensy Noel hit a seismic home run that pushed the Yankees from the verge of a pennant into an actual, competitive ALCS
David Fry hit a two-run blast off Clay Holmes in the 10th inning
Anthony Rizzo mentioned watching helplessly as Rajai Davis scored the tying run in the 2016 World Series
The game went into 15 innings before a decisive home run by David Fry
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees manager Aaron Boone called it a classic, with both sides keeping coming with haymakers and big at-bats
Luke Weaver explained that he felt he let the team down by not executing after getting one out away from a three-games-to-none lead
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Anthony Rizzo said they'll bounce back and be ready to win
Yankees still have the series lead, with two more games at home and two more if necessary in the Bronx
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians' bullpen had a 3.80 ERA this postseason
Eight pitchers combined for mostly stellar work
Second baseman Andrés Giménez and first baseman Josh Naylor made a double-gasp highlight for a pivotal out in the 10th
All four bench players wound up getting hits: David Fry, Jhonkensy Noel, Will Brennan, and Bo Naylor
